name.en: Quaternary Geology and the Critical Zone

department.ch: 應用地質研究所碩士班

goal.ch: Acquire the fundamental knowledge necessary to understand the Earth’s environments and related surface processes, natural resources and natural hazards, as well as human impact on the environment and engineering solutions to protect human settlements. Audience: undergraduate and graduate students willing to build general knowledge on this topic, as geoscientists and Earth citizens, and/or planning to work on environmental science, hydrology, engineering geology…
goal.en: Acquire the fundamental knowledge necessary to understand the Earth’s environments and related surface processes, natural resources and natural hazards, as well as human impact on the environment and engineering solutions to protect human settlements. outline.ch:
Lecture, strongly based on the analysis of observations, and discussion course on the following topics:
The Quaternary / Earth Climate system: energy flows, system dynamics and paleoclimates / Paleoclimate versus climate change / Weathering, soils, and critical zone science / Earth’s landforms and associated surface processes, sedimentary environments and natural hazards / Coastal geomorphology and sea-level changes / Quaternary dating methods / Paleoclimate archives
A list keywords or difficult terms in English and Chinese will be provided.
